verses.verse: Call now. Is there anyone answering you? And to whom of the holy ones will you turn?
For provocation kills the foolish one, and passion causes the one being simple to die.
I have seen the foolish one taking root, but suddenly I cursed his abode.
His sons are far from safety; yea, they are crushed in the gate; and there is not a deliverer.
The hungry eat his harvest, and they take him to the thorns, and the snare crushes up their strength.
For affliction does not come forth from the dust, and trouble does not spring up out of the ground;
for man is born to trouble, and the sons of the flame rise, flying upward.
Truly, I would seek to God, and to God I would put my suit,
who is doing great things, and there is no searching them; marvelous things to which is no numbering,
the One giving rain on the face of the earth and sending water on the face of the outer places;
to set the lowly on high; yea, the mourners become very high in safety;
frustrating the plots of the crafty, and their hands do not perform the undertaking,
taking the wise ones in their craftiness, and the counsel of the wily ones is hurried.
They meet with darkness by day, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
But He saves the needy one from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the strong one;
and there is hope for the weak one; and injustice shuts her mouth.
Behold, blessed is the man whom God corrects; and despise not the chastening of the Almighty.
For He wounds, and He binds up. He shatters, and His hands heal.
He will deliver you in six troubles; yea, in seven evil shall not touch you.
In famine He will redeem you from death; and in war from the hand of the sword.
You shall be hidden from the whip of the tongue, and you shall not be afraid of violence when it comes.
You shall laugh at violence and at famine; and you shall not be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
For you shall be in covenant with the stones of the field; and the beasts of the field will be at peace with you.
And you shall know that your tent is in peace; and you shall visit your abode and shall miss nothing;
and you shall know that your seed will be many, and your offspring as the grass of the earth.
You shall come to the grave in full vigor, like a stack of grain comes up in its season.
Behold this! We have searched it out; it is so. Hear it, and know it for yourself.
